front.title: Using the NETCONF Protocol over Transport Layer Security (TLS)

abstract.t: The Network Configuration Protocol (NETCONF) provides mechanisms to install, manipulate, and delete the configuration of network devices. This document describes how to use the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol to secure the exchange of NETCONF messages. This document obsoletes RFC 5539 and it adds an optional mechanism to establish the underlying TCP connection from the NETCONF server to the NETCONF client (call home).
